items.title: Voda-Three name post-merger top team, keep schtum on layoffs
items.author: Dan Robinson
items.summary:
Union estimates up to 1,600 job on the line

Vodafone and Three have detailed the exec line-up taking the reins of post-merger UK biz, yet there is no word on when the deal will close, what name it will take, or how many staff face the chop to cut role duplication.…

items.title: Watchdog ponders why Apple doesn't apply its strict app tracking rules to itself

items.summary:

Apple is feeling the heat over its acclaimed iPhone privacy policy after a German regulator's review of iOS tracking consent alleged that the tech giant exempted itself from the rules it enforces on third-party developers.…

items.summary:

items.title: HPE says blocking Juniper buy is a sure Huawei to ensure China and Cisco thrive

items.summary:

items.summary:
Talk about court red-handed

Demonstrating yet again that uncritically trusting the output of generative AI is dangerous, attorneys involved in a product liability lawsuit have apologized to the presiding judge for submitting documents that cite non-existent legal cases.…

items.title: Chinese spies suspected of 'moonlighting' as tawdry ransomware crooks

items.summary:

Hector Martin, project lead of Asahi Linux, resigned from that effort early Friday, Japan Standard Time, citing developer burnout, demanding users, and Linus Torvalds's handling of the integration of Rust code into the open source kernel.…

items.title: Analysts welcome ACID transactions on real-time distributed Aerospike

User can still push for perpetual licenses despite vendor's craving for subscription deals

items.title: Why SAP may be mulling 2030 end of maintenance for legacy ERP

items.summary:
Users' sluggish migration of critical apps mean current deadline not workable, says analyst

items.title: UK government insiders say AI datacenters may be a pricey white elephant

items.summary:

items.summary:
